name: David Letterman
monologue: This Sunday is Easter, the holiest day in Christianity. We celebrated by feeding the kids chocolate. Because honestly, if there’s one thing the kids need, it’s more sweets.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Signs Your Baseball Team Isn't Ready For The Season

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Under President Obama's new airport security plan, anyone traveling to the U.S. will be stopped if they match the description of a potential terrorist. Wait, we weren’t doing this already?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Last night, President Obama gave a speech at the Boston Opera House.  It was a long night, because you know what they say about the opera: It ain’t over ‘til the fat lady gets lectured on her eating habits by Michelle Obama.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: President Obama unveiled a new gas mileage program that he says is “like taking 58 million cars off the road for an entire year.”  Or as Toyota calls it, “business as usual.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Ford is teaming up with Microsoft to create an all-electric car called the “Microsoft Hohm.”  That’s smart.  Because if there’s one company that knows how to avoid crashes, it’s Microsoft.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: It’s a big weekend for Apple, because the iPad comes out, although its thunder was stolen last week when Ricky Martin did the same thing.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: “Clash of the Titans” does look pretty good because it’s based on Greek mythology and has the Greek icons: Zeus, Mount Olympus, the big fat weddings.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: The iPad comes out on Saturday and then on Sunday, the improved iPad comes out, which you will actually want to buy.
